lines.text: Trasgu: Congratulations clever traveler, you found Trasgu! Now excuse little Trasgu, he has places to be!
Beatriz: Not so fast! I believe you have something of mine.
Trasgu: What, who, Trasgu? He has no idea what you’re talking about.
Beatriz: Can you at least tell me who or..what you are?
Trasgu: You, lucky traveler, are in the presence of Trasgu himself! The greatest trickster of Asturias! The villagers know Trasgu as eeevil spirits haunting their homes haha!
Beatriz: I see, so the haunted rumors were all your doing. For being the “greatest trickster of Asturias”, tricking a bunch of paranoid villagers isn’t very impressive.
Trasgu: You dare question the great Trasgu?! You think some mortal like you can do better?

Beatriz: I offer a bigger challenge. If we fix the messes you’ve made you will be able to trick the monster living in the region. Fooling a big monster would make you the greatest trickster who ever lived.
Trasgu: Hmmmm..trick a monster you say? The great trickster Trasgu accepts the challenge!
Beatriz: Now, before we go, can I have my journal back?
Trasgu: What, this? Silly Trasgu didn’t realize it was yours, of course little old Trasgu would never steal from you. Now let's get going.
